abstracts.cdata!:
Following a break in relations during
            the period of military rule, the IMF resumed official
            relations with Guinea in January 2011. The new government
            that took office in January has inherited a very difficult
            macroeconomic and financial situation. In consultation with
            Fund staff, the government has adopted a short-term
            stabilization program aimed at restoring the fiscal position
            and reducing inflation. This program will be presented to
            the Fund's Executive Board as the basis for providing
            financial support to Guinea under the Rapid Credit Facility
            (RCF), covering the period January June 2011.
